timeline.message:
Add trailers after gRPC `BlockingStreamingRoute` response

Motivation:

gRPC protocol requires server to send trailers after the response
payload body to notify client about status of this response
processing. We add trailers for all service APIs except
`BlockingStreamingRoute` when service responds successfully.

Modifications:

- Add trailers with `grpc-status: 0` if `BlockingStreamingRoute`
responds without errors;

Result:

Server sends complete response with trailers from
`BlockingStreamingRoute`.

timeline.bodyText: Did you consider setting a status in grpcPayloadWriter.close() if it is not set?
timeline.author: NiteshKant

replies.bodyText:
Yes, I considered that approach, but then we have to store the ref for BufferAllocator inside DefaultGrpcPayloadWriter and do a look up for the header before setting OK.
Because OK is the most common case and we do not expose trailers in handle method (users can't change them), this approach is good enough.
